input.prompt:
The user wants to configure their NixOS system so that:
1. NixOS only installs VS Code itself (no extensions via Nix)
2. VS Code has full control to manage extensions through its built-in extension marketplace

Please help them achieve this by:
1. First, search their NixOS configuration to understand the current VS Code setup
2. Remove any VS Code extensions that are managed by Nix
3. Ensure VS Code is installed without any Nix-managed extensions
4. Make sure VS Code can freely install and manage extensions through its marketplace

The working directory is /home/aural/Code/nixos which appears to be their NixOS configuration repository.

Search for VS Code related configuration first, then make the necessary changes to give VS Code full control over extensions.

# modules/home-manager/applications.nix - User desktop applications
{ config, pkgs, lib, ... }:

{
  # Desktop applications for the user
  home.packages = with pkgs; [
    # ===== Browsers =====
    # Browsers are configured in browsers.nix

    # ===== Communication =====
    discord
    # element-desktop  # Matrix client
    # signal-desktop  # Signal messenger

    # ===== Media =====
    spotify
    vlc
    # mpv  # Alternative video player
    # audacity  # Audio editor
    # obs-studio  # Streaming/recording

    # ===== Productivity =====
    obsidian
    libreoffice-fresh  # Office suite
    # logseq  # Alternative knowledge base
    # notion-app-enhanced  # Note-taking
    # zettlr  # Markdown editor

    # ===== Development IDEs =====
    vscode
    # vscodium  # Open source VS Code
    # jetbrains.idea-community  # IntelliJ IDEA
    # sublime4  # Sublime Text
    # zed-editor  # Modern collaborative editor

    # ===== Password Management =====
    enpass
    # bitwarden  # Alternative password manager
    # keepassxc  # Offline password manager

    # ===== System Utilities =====
    flameshot  # Screenshot tool
    # copyq  # Clipboard manager
    peek  # GIF recorder
    ksnip  # Alternative screenshot tool

    # ===== Gaming =====
    # Gaming packages moved to gaming.nix

    # ===== Additional Tools =====
    gimp  # Image editor
    inkscape  # Vector graphics
    krita  # Digital painting
    blender  # 3D modeling
    freecad  # CAD software
  ];

  # Application-specific configurations

  # VS Code configuration
  programs.vscode = {
    enable = true;
    package = pkgs.vscode;
    
    # Allow VS Code to manage extensions in a mutable directory
    mutableExtensionsDir = true;

    # Note: userSettings removed to allow manual management of settings.json
    # The settings.json file at ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json
    # is now managed manually by the user, not by NixOS

    # Configuration profiles
    profiles = {
      default = {
        # Extensions to install (moved to new location per deprecation warning)
        extensions = with pkgs.vscode-extensions; [
          # Themes and Icons
          dracula-theme.theme-dracula
          pkief.material-icon-theme
          vscode-icons-team.vscode-icons

          # General Development Tools
          editorconfig.editorconfig
          streetsidesoftware.code-spell-checker
          usernamehw.errorlens
          gruntfuggly.todo-tree

          # Git Integration
          eamodio.gitlens
          mhutchie.git-graph
          donjayamanne.githistory
          github.vscode-pull-request-github

          # Nix
          jnoortheen.nix-ide

          # Python
          ms-python.python
          ms-python.vscode-pylance
          ms-python.black-formatter
          ms-python.isort
          ms-python.debugpy

          # JavaScript/TypeScript/Web
          dbaeumer.vscode-eslint
          esbenp.prettier-vscode
          bradlc.vscode-tailwindcss
          stylelint.vscode-stylelint

          # Rust
          rust-lang.rust-analyzer
          tamasfe.even-better-toml
          fill-labs.dependi

          # Go
          golang.go

          # Docker/Kubernetes/Containers
          ms-azuretools.vscode-docker
          ms-kubernetes-tools.vscode-kubernetes-tools
          ms-vscode-remote.remote-containers

          # YAML/JSON/Data Formats
          redhat.vscode-yaml

          # Markdown
          yzhang.markdown-all-in-one
          bierner.markdown-mermaid
          davidanson.vscode-markdownlint

          # Remote Development
          # ms-vscode-remote.remote-ssh  # Uncomment if needed

          # Microsoft IntelliSense
          visualstudioexptteam.vscodeintellicode
          visualstudioexptteam.intellicode-api-usage-examples

          # API Testing
          # postman.postman-for-vscode  # Not commonly available in nixpkgs
        ] ++ (
          # Extensions not available in nixpkgs but can be fetched from marketplace
          pkgs.vscode-utils.extensionsFromVscodeMarketplace [
            # Note: Claude Code extension is already added via overlay in flake.nix
            # Add any other marketplace extensions here if needed
          ]
        );
      };
    };
  };

  # Browser configurations moved to browsers.nix

  # ===== Media Application Settings =====

  # Spotify configuration
  # Note: Spotify doesn't have a Home Manager module, but we can set preferences
  home.file.".config/spotify-tui/config.yml".text = ''
    # Spotify TUI configuration (if you use spotify-tui)
    theme:
      active: Cyan
      banner: Green
      error_border: Red
      error_text: LightRed
      hint: Yellow
      hovered: Magenta
      inactive: Gray
      playbar_background: Black
      playbar_progress: Green
      playbar_text: White
      selected: LightCyan
      text: White
    behavior:
      seek_milliseconds: 5000
      volume_increment: 5
      tick_rate_milliseconds: 250
  '';

  # VLC configuration
  home.file.".config/vlc/vlcrc".text = ''
    # VLC media player preferences
    [core]
    # Interface settings
    intf=qt
    qt-minimal-view=0

    # Video settings
    video-title-show=1
    video-title-timeout=2000
    deinterlace=1
    deinterlace-mode=yadif

    # Audio settings
    audio-language=en
    volume-save=1

    # Subtitle settings
    sub-language=en
    sub-autodetect-file=1

    # Performance
    ffmpeg-hw=1
    avcodec-hw=any

    # Network
    http-reconnect=1
  '';

  # Discord configuration
  home.file.".config/discord/settings.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    # Discord settings (basic, as most are stored server-side)
    SKIP_HOST_UPDATE = true;
    MINIMIZE_TO_TRAY = true;
    OPEN_ON_STARTUP = false;
  };

  # ===== Productivity Application Settings =====

  # Obsidian configuration
  # Note: Obsidian stores most settings in the vault, but we can set app preferences
  home.file.".config/obsidian/obsidian.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    vaults = {
      # Add your vault paths here if you want them pre-configured
      # "vault-id" = {
      #   path = "/home/aural/Documents/ObsidianVault";
      #   open = true;
      # };
    };
    # App preferences
    theme = "obsidian";
    showRibbon = true;
    showLeftSidebar = true;
    showRightSidebar = true;
    alwaysUpdateLinks = true;
  };

  # LibreOffice configuration
  # Note: LibreOffice stores config in a complex structure, but we can set some defaults
  home.file.".config/libreoffice/4/user/registrymodifications.xcu".text = ''
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <oor:items xmlns:oor="http://openoffice.org/2001/registry" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
      <!-- Save in ODF format by default -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Filter/Microsoft/Export">
        <prop oor:name="SaveAlwaysAllowed" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>false</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Default font -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Writer/DefaultFont">
        <prop oor:name="Standard" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>Liberation Sans;12</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Auto-save every 10 minutes -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Save/Document">
        <prop oor:name="AutoSave" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>true</value>
        </prop>
        <prop oor:name="AutoSaveTimeIntervall" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>10</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
    </oor:items>
  '';

  # Thunderbird configuration (if you decide to use it)
  # home.file.".thunderbird/profiles.ini".text = ''
  #   [Profile0]
  #   Name=default
  #   IsRelative=1
  #   Path=default.profile
  #   Default=1
  # '';

  # XDG configuration moved to xdg.nix
}

file.content:
# modules/desktop/applications.nix - Essential desktop applications
{ pkgs, ... }:

{
  environment.systemPackages = with pkgs; [
    # Communication - Start with essentials
    discord
    
    # Music & Media
    spotify
    vlc              # Media player
    
    # Development IDE
    vscode           # VS Code without extensions initially
    
    # Productivity
    obsidian         # Note-taking
    thunderbird      # Email client (commented out in main config)
    libreoffice      # Office suite
    
    # Graphics & Utilities
    flameshot        # Screenshot tool
    
    # System Utilities for KDE
    kdePackages.ark  # Archive manager for KDE (Qt6 version)
    # kate is already included in user packages
    
    # Password Management
    enpass           # Password manager you actually use
  ];
  
  # Required for proprietary packages
  nixpkgs.config.allowUnfree = true;
}

content.text: Perfect! I can see the current VS Code configuration. The issue is in `/home/aural/Code/nixos/modules/home-manager/applications.nix` where VS Code is configured with a large list of Nix-managed extensions (lines 76-146). # modules/home-manager/applications.nix - User desktop applications
{ config, pkgs, lib, ... }:

{
  # Desktop applications for the user
  home.packages = with pkgs; [
    # ===== Browsers =====
    # Browsers are configured in browsers.nix

    # ===== Communication =====
    discord
    # element-desktop  # Matrix client
    # signal-desktop  # Signal messenger

    # ===== Media =====
    spotify
    vlc
    # mpv  # Alternative video player
    # audacity  # Audio editor
    # obs-studio  # Streaming/recording

    # ===== Productivity =====
    obsidian
    libreoffice-fresh  # Office suite
    # logseq  # Alternative knowledge base
    # notion-app-enhanced  # Note-taking
    # zettlr  # Markdown editor

    # ===== Development IDEs =====
    vscode
    # vscodium  # Open source VS Code
    # jetbrains.idea-community  # IntelliJ IDEA
    # sublime4  # Sublime Text
    # zed-editor  # Modern collaborative editor

    # ===== Password Management =====
    enpass
    # bitwarden  # Alternative password manager
    # keepassxc  # Offline password manager

    # ===== System Utilities =====
    flameshot  # Screenshot tool
    # copyq  # Clipboard manager
    peek  # GIF recorder
    ksnip  # Alternative screenshot tool

    # ===== Gaming =====
    # Gaming packages moved to gaming.nix

    # ===== Additional Tools =====
    gimp  # Image editor
    inkscape  # Vector graphics
    krita  # Digital painting
    blender  # 3D modeling
    freecad  # CAD software
  ];

  # Application-specific configurations

  # VS Code configuration
  programs.vscode = {
    enable = true;
    package = pkgs.vscode;
    
    # Allow VS Code to manage extensions in a mutable directory
    mutableExtensionsDir = true;

    # Note: userSettings removed to allow manual management of settings.json
    # The settings.json file at ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json
    # is now managed manually by the user, not by NixOS

    # Configuration profiles
    profiles = {
      default = {
        # Extensions to install (moved to new location per deprecation warning)
        extensions = with pkgs.vscode-extensions; [
          # Themes and Icons
          dracula-theme.theme-dracula
          pkief.material-icon-theme
          vscode-icons-team.vscode-icons

          # General Development Tools
          editorconfig.editorconfig
          streetsidesoftware.code-spell-checker
          usernamehw.errorlens
          gruntfuggly.todo-tree

          # Git Integration
          eamodio.gitlens
          mhutchie.git-graph
          donjayamanne.githistory
          github.vscode-pull-request-github

          # Nix
          jnoortheen.nix-ide

          # Python
          ms-python.python
          ms-python.vscode-pylance
          ms-python.black-formatter
          ms-python.isort
          ms-python.debugpy

          # JavaScript/TypeScript/Web
          dbaeumer.vscode-eslint
          esbenp.prettier-vscode
          bradlc.vscode-tailwindcss
          stylelint.vscode-stylelint

          # Rust
          rust-lang.rust-analyzer
          tamasfe.even-better-toml
          fill-labs.dependi

          # Go
          golang.go

          # Docker/Kubernetes/Containers
          ms-azuretools.vscode-docker
          ms-kubernetes-tools.vscode-kubernetes-tools
          ms-vscode-remote.remote-containers

          # YAML/JSON/Data Formats
          redhat.vscode-yaml

          # Markdown
          yzhang.markdown-all-in-one
          bierner.markdown-mermaid
          davidanson.vscode-markdownlint

          # Remote Development
          # ms-vscode-remote.remote-ssh  # Uncomment if needed

          # Microsoft IntelliSense
          visualstudioexptteam.vscodeintellicode
          visualstudioexptteam.intellicode-api-usage-examples

          # API Testing
          # postman.postman-for-vscode  # Not commonly available in nixpkgs
        ] ++ (
          # Extensions not available in nixpkgs but can be fetched from marketplace
          pkgs.vscode-utils.extensionsFromVscodeMarketplace [
            # Note: Claude Code extension is already added via overlay in flake.nix
            # Add any other marketplace extensions here if needed
          ]
        );
      };
    };
  };

  # Browser configurations moved to browsers.nix

  # ===== Media Application Settings =====

  # Spotify configuration
  # Note: Spotify doesn't have a Home Manager module, but we can set preferences
  home.file.".config/spotify-tui/config.yml".text = ''
    # Spotify TUI configuration (if you use spotify-tui)
    theme:
      active: Cyan
      banner: Green
      error_border: Red
      error_text: LightRed
      hint: Yellow
      hovered: Magenta
      inactive: Gray
      playbar_background: Black
      playbar_progress: Green
      playbar_text: White
      selected: LightCyan
      text: White
    behavior:
      seek_milliseconds: 5000
      volume_increment: 5
      tick_rate_milliseconds: 250
  '';

  # VLC configuration
  home.file.".config/vlc/vlcrc".text = ''
    # VLC media player preferences
    [core]
    # Interface settings
    intf=qt
    qt-minimal-view=0

    # Video settings
    video-title-show=1
    video-title-timeout=2000
    deinterlace=1
    deinterlace-mode=yadif

    # Audio settings
    audio-language=en
    volume-save=1

    # Subtitle settings
    sub-language=en
    sub-autodetect-file=1

    # Performance
    ffmpeg-hw=1
    avcodec-hw=any

    # Network
    http-reconnect=1
  '';

  # Discord configuration
  home.file.".config/discord/settings.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    # Discord settings (basic, as most are stored server-side)
    SKIP_HOST_UPDATE = true;
    MINIMIZE_TO_TRAY = true;
    OPEN_ON_STARTUP = false;
  };

  # ===== Productivity Application Settings =====

  # Obsidian configuration
  # Note: Obsidian stores most settings in the vault, but we can set app preferences
  home.file.".config/obsidian/obsidian.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    vaults = {
      # Add your vault paths here if you want them pre-configured
      # "vault-id" = {
      #   path = "/home/aural/Documents/ObsidianVault";
      #   open = true;
      # };
    };
    # App preferences
    theme = "obsidian";
    showRibbon = true;
    showLeftSidebar = true;
    showRightSidebar = true;
    alwaysUpdateLinks = true;
  };

  # LibreOffice configuration
  # Note: LibreOffice stores config in a complex structure, but we can set some defaults
  home.file.".config/libreoffice/4/user/registrymodifications.xcu".text = ''
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <oor:items xmlns:oor="http://openoffice.org/2001/registry" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
      <!-- Save in ODF format by default -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Filter/Microsoft/Export">
        <prop oor:name="SaveAlwaysAllowed" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>false</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Default font -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Writer/DefaultFont">
        <prop oor:name="Standard" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>Liberation Sans;12</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Auto-save every 10 minutes -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Save/Document">
        <prop oor:name="AutoSave" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>true</value>
        </prop>
        <prop oor:name="AutoSaveTimeIntervall" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>10</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
    </oor:items>
  '';

  # Thunderbird configuration (if you decide to use it)
  # home.file.".thunderbird/profiles.ini".text = ''
  #   [Profile0]
  #   Name=default
  #   IsRelative=1
  #   Path=default.profile
  #   Default=1
  # '';

  # XDG configuration moved to xdg.nix
}

content.text:
Excellent! The changes have been committed successfully. Now let me provide you with a summary of what has been done and instructions for applying these changes.

## Summary of Changes Made

I've successfully configured your NixOS system to give VS Code full control over extension management. Here's what was changed:

### Files Modified:

1. **`/home/aural/Code/nixos/modules/home-manager/applications.nix`**:
   - Removed all Nix-managed VS Code extensions (about 70 lines of extension definitions)
   - Kept the `programs.vscode` configuration with `mutableExtensionsDir = true`
   - Removed the duplicate VS Code package from `home.packages`
   - Added clear documentation about the new approach

2. **`/home/aural/Code/nixos/modules/desktop/applications.nix`**:
   - Removed the duplicate VS Code system package to avoid conflicts
   - Added comment explaining it's now managed via home-manager

### Key Configuration Features:

- **VS Code Installation**: Still installed via NixOS but through the `programs.vscode` module
- **Extension Management**: Completely handled by VS Code's built-in extension marketplace
- **Mutable Extensions Directory**: Enabled (`mutableExtensionsDir = true`) allowing VS Code to manage extensions in `~/.vscode/extensions/`
- **No Nix-Managed Extensions**: All previously Nix-managed extensions removed
- **Settings Management**: Your VS Code settings.json remains user-managed (not controlled by Nix)

## How to Apply These Changes

To apply these configuration changes to your system:

```bash
# Navigate to your NixOS configuration directory
cd /home/aural/Code/nixos

# Apply the configuration changes
sudo nixos-rebuild switch

# Or for testing first (optional)
sudo nixos-rebuild test
```

## What Will Happen After Rebuild:

1. **Current Extensions**: Any extensions currently installed via Nix will be removed
2. **VS Code Functionality**: VS Code will still be installed and work normally  
3. **Extension Installation**: You can now install any extension directly through VS Code:
   - Open VS Code
   - Go to Extensions (Ctrl+Shift+X)
   - Search and install any extensions you want
   - Extensions will auto-update
   - No system rebuilds needed for extension changes

## Benefits of This Configuration:

- ✅ **Full Marketplace Access**: Install any extension from the VS Code marketplace
- ✅ **Automatic Updates**: Extensions update automatically without system rebuilds
- ✅ **Easy Management**: Install/remove extensions through VS Code UI
- ✅ **User Choice**: Choose specific extension versions if needed
- ✅ **No Rebuild Dependencies**: Extension changes don't require NixOS rebuilds
- ✅ **Faster Iterations**: Immediate extension installation and testing

## Note About Claude Code Extension:

The Claude Code extension will still be available because it's installed via the overlay in your `flake.nix`. If you want VS Code to have complete control over this extension too, you would need to:

1. Remove the Claude Code overlay from `flake.nix` 
2. Install Claude Code extension manually through VS Code marketplace

However, I recommend keeping the current setup where Claude Code is managed via Nix (as it ensures it stays updated with your system), while letting VS Code manage all other extensions.

Your NixOS configuration now provides the perfect balance: system-managed VS Code installation with user-controlled extension management!

content.text:
Let me try a simpler approach. Based on my analysis, the most likely cause is that when both KDE Plasma 6 and XFCE are enabled (as shown in desktop-selector.nix), there might be conflicting theme packages being pulled in. 

Looking at the desktop-selector.nix configuration:
- `plasma = true` (enables KDE Plasma 6)
- `xfce = true` (enables XFCE)

The issue is likely that some packages are pulling in both Qt5 and Qt6 versions of breeze themes. Since Plasma 6 uses Qt6 and some legacy applications might still depend on Qt5, this creates the collision.

Let me check what might be causing this by looking at the exact collision more closely. First, let me try to reproduce the issue or get more information:

Perfect! I can see the issue now. There are multiple versions of breeze packages:
- `breeze-5.27.11` (Qt5/Plasma 5 version)
- `breeze-6.3.6` and `breeze-6.4.3` (Qt6/Plasma 6 versions)

The collision is likely happening because both the Qt5 and Qt6 versions of breeze are being installed simultaneously. This typically happens when:

1. KDE Plasma 6 is enabled (pulls in Qt6 breeze packages)
2. Some other package or configuration is pulling in Qt5 breeze packages

file.content:
# modules/home-manager/applications.nix - User desktop applications
{ config, pkgs, lib, ... }:

{
  # Desktop applications for the user
  home.packages = with pkgs; [
    # ===== Browsers =====
    # Browsers are configured in browsers.nix

    # ===== Communication =====
    discord
    # element-desktop  # Matrix client
    # signal-desktop  # Signal messenger

    # ===== Media =====
    spotify
    vlc
    # mpv  # Alternative video player
    # audacity  # Audio editor
    # obs-studio  # Streaming/recording

    # ===== Productivity =====
    obsidian
    libreoffice-fresh  # Office suite
    # logseq  # Alternative knowledge base
    # notion-app-enhanced  # Note-taking
    # zettlr  # Markdown editor

    # ===== Development IDEs =====
    # vscode configured via programs.vscode module below
    # vscodium  # Open source VS Code
    # jetbrains.idea-community  # IntelliJ IDEA
    # sublime4  # Sublime Text
    # zed-editor  # Modern collaborative editor

    # ===== Password Management =====
    enpass
    # bitwarden  # Alternative password manager
    # keepassxc  # Offline password manager

    # ===== System Utilities =====
    flameshot  # Screenshot tool
    # copyq  # Clipboard manager
    peek  # GIF recorder
    ksnip  # Alternative screenshot tool

    # ===== Gaming =====
    # Gaming packages moved to gaming.nix

    # ===== Additional Tools =====
    gimp  # Image editor
    inkscape  # Vector graphics
    krita  # Digital painting
    blender  # 3D modeling
    freecad  # CAD software
  ];

  # Application-specific configurations

  # VS Code configuration - Minimal setup with full extension management freedom
  programs.vscode = {
    enable = true;
    package = pkgs.vscode;
    
    # Allow VS Code to manage extensions in a mutable directory
    mutableExtensionsDir = true;

    # Note: userSettings removed to allow manual management of settings.json
    # The settings.json file at ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json
    # is now managed manually by the user, not by NixOS

    # No extensions managed by Nix - VS Code has full control
    # All extensions should be installed through VS Code's extension marketplace
    # This allows for:
    # - Automatic updates
    # - Easy installation/removal
    # - Access to the full marketplace
    # - User preferences for extension versions
  };

  # Browser configurations moved to browsers.nix

  # ===== Media Application Settings =====

  # Spotify configuration
  # Note: Spotify doesn't have a Home Manager module, but we can set preferences
  home.file.".config/spotify-tui/config.yml".text = ''
    # Spotify TUI configuration (if you use spotify-tui)
    theme:
      active: Cyan
      banner: Green
      error_border: Red
      error_text: LightRed
      hint: Yellow
      hovered: Magenta
      inactive: Gray
      playbar_background: Black
      playbar_progress: Green
      playbar_text: White
      selected: LightCyan
      text: White
    behavior:
      seek_milliseconds: 5000
      volume_increment: 5
      tick_rate_milliseconds: 250
  '';

  # VLC configuration
  home.file.".config/vlc/vlcrc".text = ''
    # VLC media player preferences
    [core]
    # Interface settings
    intf=qt
    qt-minimal-view=0

    # Video settings
    video-title-show=1
    video-title-timeout=2000
    deinterlace=1
    deinterlace-mode=yadif

    # Audio settings
    audio-language=en
    volume-save=1

    # Subtitle settings
    sub-language=en
    sub-autodetect-file=1

    # Performance
    ffmpeg-hw=1
    avcodec-hw=any

    # Network
    http-reconnect=1
  '';

  # Discord configuration
  home.file.".config/discord/settings.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    # Discord settings (basic, as most are stored server-side)
    SKIP_HOST_UPDATE = true;
    MINIMIZE_TO_TRAY = true;
    OPEN_ON_STARTUP = false;
  };

  # ===== Productivity Application Settings =====

  # Obsidian configuration
  # Note: Obsidian stores most settings in the vault, but we can set app preferences
  home.file.".config/obsidian/obsidian.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    vaults = {
      # Add your vault paths here if you want them pre-configured
      # "vault-id" = {
      #   path = "/home/aural/Documents/ObsidianVault";
      #   open = true;
      # };
    };
    # App preferences
    theme = "obsidian";
    showRibbon = true;
    showLeftSidebar = true;
    showRightSidebar = true;
    alwaysUpdateLinks = true;
  };

  # LibreOffice configuration
  # Note: LibreOffice stores config in a complex structure, but we can set some defaults
  home.file.".config/libreoffice/4/user/registrymodifications.xcu".text = ''
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <oor:items xmlns:oor="http://openoffice.org/2001/registry" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
      <!-- Save in ODF format by default -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Filter/Microsoft/Export">
        <prop oor:name="SaveAlwaysAllowed" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>false</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Default font -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Writer/DefaultFont">
        <prop oor:name="Standard" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>Liberation Sans;12</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Auto-save every 10 minutes -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Save/Document">
        <prop oor:name="AutoSave" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>true</value>
        </prop>
        <prop oor:name="AutoSaveTimeIntervall" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>10</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
    </oor:items>
  '';

  # Thunderbird configuration (if you decide to use it)
  # home.file.".thunderbird/profiles.ini".text = ''
  #   [Profile0]
  #   Name=default
  #   IsRelative=1
  #   Path=default.profile
  #   Default=1
  # '';

  # XDG configuration moved to xdg.nix
}

content.text:
Let me try a different approach. Based on my analysis, the most likely cause is the collision between Qt5 and Qt6 versions of the breeze theme. The solution is to explicitly exclude the conflicting packages. 

In NixOS, when you have both KDE Plasma 6 (Qt6) and some applications that still use Qt5, this collision can occur. The solution is to use `environment.systemPackages` with proper exclusions or to use `nixpkgs.config.packageOverrides`.

Let me create a solution by modifying the configuration to resolve this collision:

Now I have a clear picture of the issue. The collision is happening because:

1. **KDE Plasma 6 is enabled** (line 37: `services.desktopManager.plasma6.enable = desktopConfig.plasma;`) - this automatically includes Qt6 breeze theme packages
2. **XFCE is also enabled** (line 39: `services.xserver.desktopManager.xfce.enable = desktopConfig.xfce;`) - XFCE might pull in some Qt5 applications or themes
3. **Applications like VLC** may depend on Qt5 libraries which could include breeze themes

The solution is to explicitly handle this collision by preventing the installation of conflicting Qt5 breeze packages when Plasma 6 is enabled. Here's how to fix it:

lines: +  # Prevent Qt5/Qt6 breeze theme collisions when Plasma 6 is enabled
+  # This ensures only Qt6 breeze themes are used, avoiding package collisions
+    # Override Qt5 breeze packages to prevent collisions with Qt6 versions
# Ensure KDE notification service takes priority when both are installed

# This ensures only Qt6 breeze themes are used, avoiding package collisions

# Prevent Qt5/Qt6 breeze theme collisions when Plasma 6 is enabled
  # This resolves conflicts by ensuring consistent theme packages
  environment.systemPackages = lib.mkIf desktopConfig.plasma (with pkgs; [
    # Explicitly include Qt6 breeze packages to prevent Qt5 versions from being pulled in
    kdePackages.breeze
    kdePackages.breeze-icons
    kdePackages.breeze-gtk
  ]);

content.text: Let me try a much simpler and more reliable approach. Let me remove that complex configuration and instead add a simple fix that addresses the most common cause of this collision:

input.new_string:
# Resolve breeze theme package collisions between Qt5 and Qt6
  # When Plasma 6 is enabled, prevent Qt5 breeze packages from causing conflicts
  environment.etc."xdg/kdeglobals".text = lib.mkIf desktopConfig.plasma ''
    # KDE Global configuration to ensure consistent theming
    [General]
    ColorScheme=Breeze
    
    [Icons]
    Theme=breeze
  '';

  # Ensure Qt5 applications use system theme integration
  qt.enable = lib.mkIf desktopConfig.plasma true;
  qt.platformTheme = lib.mkIf desktopConfig.plasma "kde";

content.text:
Perfect! Let me also provide a summary of what we discovered and fixed:

## Summary: Breeze Package Collision Fix

### The Problem
You were experiencing a collision warning during `nixos-rebuild test` related to breeze theme packages. The warning message indicated that multiple packages were trying to install files to the same paths in the Nix store, specifically involving breeze themes.

### Root Cause Analysis
The collision occurred because your NixOS configuration had:
1. **KDE Plasma 6 enabled** - which automatically includes Qt6 breeze theme packages (`kdePackages.breeze-*`)
2. **XFCE also enabled** - running alongside KDE Plasma 6
3. **Applications using Qt5** - Some applications (like VLC) depend on Qt5 libraries, which can pull in Qt5 versions of breeze themes (`libsForQt5.breeze-*`)

When both Qt5 and Qt6 versions of breeze packages try to install files to the same system paths, NixOS detects this as a collision and issues a warning.

### The Solution
I implemented a targeted fix in `/home/aural/Code/nixos/modules/desktop/desktop-selector.nix`:

```nix
# Fix breeze theme package collisions between Qt5 and Qt6 versions
# This collision occurs when Plasma 6 (Qt6) and some Qt5 apps both try to install breeze themes
(lib.optionals desktopConfig.plasma [
  # Explicitly prioritize Qt6 breeze packages to resolve conflicts
  (lib.hiPrio kdePackages.breeze-icons)
  (lib.hiPrio kdePackages.breeze-gtk)
])
```

### How the Fix Works
- **High Priority Packages**: Uses `lib.hiPrio` to give Qt6 breeze packages higher priority than Qt5 versions
- **Conditional Application**: Only applies when KDE Plasma is enabled (`desktopConfig.plasma`)
- **Targeted Packages**: Specifically addresses the most common collision sources (`breeze-icons` and `breeze-gtk`)
- **Integrated Approach**: Added to the existing `environment.systemPackages` definition to avoid configuration conflicts

### Verification
The fix was tested and verified:
- ✅ Configuration syntax is valid
- ✅ `nixos-rebuild test --flake .` completed successfully with exit code 0
- ✅ No collision warnings appeared in the build output
- ✅ Only expected warnings about dirty Git tree (due to our changes)

### Files Modified
- `/home/aural/Code/nixos/modules/desktop/desktop-selector.nix` - Added high-priority Qt6 breeze packages when Plasma 6 is enabled

The collision warning should now be resolved, and your system will use consistent Qt6 breeze theming while maintaining compatibility with Qt5 applications.

file.content:
# modules/home-manager/applications.nix - User desktop applications
{ config, pkgs, lib, ... }:

{
  # Desktop applications for the user
  home.packages = with pkgs; [
    # ===== Browsers =====
    # Browsers are configured in browsers.nix

    # ===== Communication =====
    discord
    # element-desktop  # Matrix client
    # signal-desktop  # Signal messenger

    # ===== Media =====
    spotify
    vlc
    # mpv  # Alternative video player
    # audacity  # Audio editor
    # obs-studio  # Streaming/recording

    # ===== Productivity =====
    obsidian
    libreoffice-fresh  # Office suite
    # logseq  # Alternative knowledge base
    # notion-app-enhanced  # Note-taking
    # zettlr  # Markdown editor

    # ===== Development IDEs =====
    # vscode configured via programs.vscode module below
    # vscodium  # Open source VS Code
    # jetbrains.idea-community  # IntelliJ IDEA
    # sublime4  # Sublime Text
    # zed-editor  # Modern collaborative editor

    # ===== Password Management =====
    enpass
    # bitwarden  # Alternative password manager
    # keepassxc  # Offline password manager

    # ===== System Utilities =====
    flameshot  # Screenshot tool
    # copyq  # Clipboard manager
    peek  # GIF recorder
    ksnip  # Alternative screenshot tool

    # ===== Gaming =====
    # Gaming packages moved to gaming.nix

    # ===== Additional Tools =====
    gimp  # Image editor
    inkscape  # Vector graphics
    krita  # Digital painting
    blender  # 3D modeling
    freecad  # CAD software
  ];

  # Application-specific configurations

  # VS Code configuration - Minimal setup with full extension management freedom
  programs.vscode = {
    enable = true;
    package = pkgs.vscode;
    
    # Allow VS Code to manage extensions in a mutable directory
    mutableExtensionsDir = true;

    # Note: userSettings removed to allow manual management of settings.json
    # The settings.json file at ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json
    # is now managed manually by the user, not by NixOS

    # No extensions managed by Nix - VS Code has full control
    # All extensions should be installed through VS Code's extension marketplace
    # This allows for:
    # - Automatic updates
    # - Easy installation/removal
    # - Access to the full marketplace
    # - User preferences for extension versions
  };

  # Browser configurations moved to browsers.nix

  # ===== Media Application Settings =====

  # Spotify configuration
  # Note: Spotify doesn't have a Home Manager module, but we can set preferences
  home.file.".config/spotify-tui/config.yml".text = ''
    # Spotify TUI configuration (if you use spotify-tui)
    theme:
      active: Cyan
      banner: Green
      error_border: Red
      error_text: LightRed
      hint: Yellow
      hovered: Magenta
      inactive: Gray
      playbar_background: Black
      playbar_progress: Green
      playbar_text: White
      selected: LightCyan
      text: White
    behavior:
      seek_milliseconds: 5000
      volume_increment: 5
      tick_rate_milliseconds: 250
  '';

  # VLC configuration
  home.file.".config/vlc/vlcrc".text = ''
    # VLC media player preferences
    [core]
    # Interface settings
    intf=qt
    qt-minimal-view=0

    # Video settings
    video-title-show=1
    video-title-timeout=2000
    deinterlace=1
    deinterlace-mode=yadif

    # Audio settings
    audio-language=en
    volume-save=1

    # Subtitle settings
    sub-language=en
    sub-autodetect-file=1

    # Performance
    ffmpeg-hw=1
    avcodec-hw=any

    # Network
    http-reconnect=1
  '';

  # Discord configuration
  home.file.".config/discord/settings.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    # Discord settings (basic, as most are stored server-side)
    SKIP_HOST_UPDATE = true;
    MINIMIZE_TO_TRAY = true;
    OPEN_ON_STARTUP = false;
  };

  # ===== Productivity Application Settings =====

  # Obsidian configuration
  # Note: Obsidian stores most settings in the vault, but we can set app preferences
  home.file.".config/obsidian/obsidian.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    vaults = {
      # Add your vault paths here if you want them pre-configured
      # "vault-id" = {
      #   path = "/home/aural/Documents/ObsidianVault";
      #   open = true;
      # };
    };
    # App preferences
    theme = "obsidian";
    showRibbon = true;
    showLeftSidebar = true;
    showRightSidebar = true;
    alwaysUpdateLinks = true;
  };

  # LibreOffice configuration
  # Note: LibreOffice stores config in a complex structure, but we can set some defaults
  home.file.".config/libreoffice/4/user/registrymodifications.xcu".text = ''
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <oor:items xmlns:oor="http://openoffice.org/2001/registry" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
      <!-- Save in ODF format by default -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Filter/Microsoft/Export">
        <prop oor:name="SaveAlwaysAllowed" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>false</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Default font -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Writer/DefaultFont">
        <prop oor:name="Standard" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>Liberation Sans;12</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Auto-save every 10 minutes -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Save/Document">
        <prop oor:name="AutoSave" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>true</value>
        </prop>
        <prop oor:name="AutoSaveTimeIntervall" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>10</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
    </oor:items>
  '';

  # Thunderbird configuration (if you decide to use it)
  # home.file.".thunderbird/profiles.ini".text = ''
  #   [Profile0]
  #   Name=default
  #   IsRelative=1
  #   Path=default.profile

content.text:
Based on my investigation, you have **very few Qt5 applications**. The main Qt5 dependencies in your system are:

**Applications using Qt5:**
- **ksnip** - Screenshot tool (uses Qt5 libraries: qtbase, qtsvg, qtwayland, etc.)
- **Python packages** - PyQt5 (likely pulled in as a dependency)
- **plasma-integration-qt5** - Compatibility layer for Qt5 apps in Plasma 6

Most of your applications actually use Qt6 or are not Qt-based:
- **VLC** - Uses Qt6 (phonon_vlc_qt6.so)
- **Obsidian, Discord, Spotify** - Electron-based (not Qt)
- **LibreOffice** - Uses its own toolkit
- **GIMP, Inkscape, Krita, Blender, FreeCAD** - Mix of GTK and custom toolkits
- **Flameshot, Peek** - Likely GTK-based

The Qt5/Qt6 collision was mainly caused by:
1. **ksnip** (Qt5) vs KDE Plasma 6's breeze themes (Qt6)
2. The system keeping Qt5 compatibility layers for any legacy apps

Since you have minimal Qt5 usage, the fix I applied (prioritizing Qt6 breeze themes) was the right approach. You might consider replacing ksnip with a Qt6/GTK alternative like Flameshot if you want to eliminate Qt5 entirely.

file.content:
# modules/home-manager/applications.nix - User desktop applications
{ config, pkgs, lib, ... }:

{
  # Desktop applications for the user
  home.packages = with pkgs; [
    # ===== Browsers =====
    # Browsers are configured in browsers.nix

    # ===== Communication =====
    discord
    # element-desktop  # Matrix client
    # signal-desktop  # Signal messenger

    # ===== Media =====
    spotify
    vlc
    # mpv  # Alternative video player
    # audacity  # Audio editor
    # obs-studio  # Streaming/recording

    # ===== Productivity =====
    obsidian
    libreoffice-fresh  # Office suite
    # logseq  # Alternative knowledge base
    # notion-app-enhanced  # Note-taking
    # zettlr  # Markdown editor

    # ===== Development IDEs =====
    # vscode configured via programs.vscode module below
    # vscodium  # Open source VS Code
    # jetbrains.idea-community  # IntelliJ IDEA
    # sublime4  # Sublime Text
    # zed-editor  # Modern collaborative editor

    # ===== Password Management =====
    enpass
    # bitwarden  # Alternative password manager
    # keepassxc  # Offline password manager

    # ===== System Utilities =====
    flameshot  # Screenshot tool
    # copyq  # Clipboard manager
    peek  # GIF recorder
    ksnip  # Alternative screenshot tool

    # ===== Gaming =====
    # Gaming packages moved to gaming.nix

    # ===== Additional Tools =====
    gimp  # Image editor
    inkscape  # Vector graphics
    krita  # Digital painting
    blender  # 3D modeling
    freecad  # CAD software
  ];

  # Application-specific configurations

  # VS Code configuration - Minimal setup with full extension management freedom
  programs.vscode = {
    enable = true;
    package = pkgs.vscode;
    
    # Allow VS Code to manage extensions in a mutable directory
    mutableExtensionsDir = true;

    # Note: userSettings removed to allow manual management of settings.json
    # The settings.json file at ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json
    # is now managed manually by the user, not by NixOS

    # No extensions managed by Nix - VS Code has full control
    # All extensions should be installed through VS Code's extension marketplace
    # This allows for:
    # - Automatic updates
    # - Easy installation/removal
    # - Access to the full marketplace
    # - User preferences for extension versions
  };

  # Browser configurations moved to browsers.nix

  # ===== Media Application Settings =====

  # Spotify configuration
  # Note: Spotify doesn't have a Home Manager module, but we can set preferences
  home.file.".config/spotify-tui/config.yml".text = ''
    # Spotify TUI configuration (if you use spotify-tui)
    theme:
      active: Cyan
      banner: Green
      error_border: Red
      error_text: LightRed
      hint: Yellow
      hovered: Magenta
      inactive: Gray
      playbar_background: Black
      playbar_progress: Green
      playbar_text: White
      selected: LightCyan
      text: White
    behavior:
      seek_milliseconds: 5000
      volume_increment: 5
      tick_rate_milliseconds: 250
  '';

  # VLC configuration
  home.file.".config/vlc/vlcrc".text = ''
    # VLC media player preferences
    [core]
    # Interface settings
    intf=qt
    qt-minimal-view=0

    # Video settings
    video-title-show=1
    video-title-timeout=2000
    deinterlace=1
    deinterlace-mode=yadif

    # Audio settings
    audio-language=en
    volume-save=1

    # Subtitle settings
    sub-language=en
    sub-autodetect-file=1

    # Performance
    ffmpeg-hw=1
    avcodec-hw=any

    # Network
    http-reconnect=1
  '';

  # Discord configuration
  home.file.".config/discord/settings.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    # Discord settings (basic, as most are stored server-side)
    SKIP_HOST_UPDATE = true;
    MINIMIZE_TO_TRAY = true;
    OPEN_ON_STARTUP = false;
  };

  # ===== Productivity Application Settings =====

  # Obsidian configuration
  # Note: Obsidian stores most settings in the vault, but we can set app preferences
  home.file.".config/obsidian/obsidian.json".text = builtins.toJSON {
    vaults = {
      # Add your vault paths here if you want them pre-configured
      # "vault-id" = {
      #   path = "/home/aural/Documents/ObsidianVault";
      #   open = true;
      # };
    };
    # App preferences
    theme = "obsidian";
    showRibbon = true;
    showLeftSidebar = true;
    showRightSidebar = true;
    alwaysUpdateLinks = true;
  };

  # LibreOffice configuration
  # Note: LibreOffice stores config in a complex structure, but we can set some defaults
  home.file.".config/libreoffice/4/user/registrymodifications.xcu".text = ''
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <oor:items xmlns:oor="http://openoffice.org/2001/registry" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
      <!-- Save in ODF format by default -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Filter/Microsoft/Export">
        <prop oor:name="SaveAlwaysAllowed" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>false</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Default font -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Writer/DefaultFont">
        <prop oor:name="Standard" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>Liberation Sans;12</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
      <!-- Auto-save every 10 minutes -->
      <item oor:path="/org.openoffice.Office.Common/Save/Document">
        <prop oor:name="AutoSave" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>true</value>
        </prop>
        <prop oor:name="AutoSaveTimeIntervall" oor:op="fuse">
          <value>10</value>
        </prop>
      </item>
    </oor:items>
  '';

  # Thunderbird configuration (if you decide to use it)
  # home.file.".thunderbird/profiles.ini".text = ''
  #   [Profile0]
  #   Name=default
  #   IsRelative=1
  #   Path=default.profile
  #   Default=1
  # '';

  # XDG configuration moved to xdg.nix
}
